member.name: T:Remotion.ObjectBinding.BusinessObjectDataSource
member.summary: The default implementation of the interface.
member.remarks: Any specialized version of the BusinessObjectDataSource requires an override for the property. It is also necessary to provide a way for specifying which will be returned by this property. See the remarks section of the interface documentation for details on how to implement this feature.

member.name: T:Remotion.ObjectBinding.IBusinessObjectDataSource
member.summary: This interface provides funtionality for binding an to an . Each business object model requires a specialized implementation of this interface.

remarks.para: For most situations, the default implementation provided by can be used as a base for the implementation.

The data source usually provides a way of specifying a type identifier. This identifier is used to get or instantiate the matching from the object model.
It is important to use an identifier that can be persisted as a string. Otherwise it would not be possible to specify and later persist the in the Visual Studio .NET Designer, preventing any further design time features from working.
See the Remotion.ObjectBinding namespace documentation for general information on the data binding process.

member.name: M:Remotion.ObjectBinding.IBusinessObjectDataSource.LoadValues(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Loads the values of the into all bound controls.
member.param: Specifies whether this is the initial loading, or an interim loading.
member.remarks: On initial loads, all values must be loaded. On interim loads, each decides whether it keeps its own value (e.g., using view state) or reloads the value (useful for complex structures that need no validation).

member.name: M:Remotion.ObjectBinding.IBusinessObjectDataSource.SaveValues(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Saves the values of the from all bound controls implementing .
member.param: Specifies whether this is the final saving, or an interim saving.
member.remarks: On final saves, all values must be saved. (It is assumed that invalid values were already identified using validators.) On interim saves, each decides whether it saves its values into the or uses an alternate mechanism (e.g. view state).

member.name: T:Remotion.ObjectBinding.IBusinessObjectReferenceDataSource
member.summary: This interface provides functionality to access to the returned by other data sources using the specified .

remarks.para:
Through the use of an IBusinessObjectReferenceDataSource it is possible to access a referenced identified by the from the primary connected to the . The referenced object is then used as this 's , allowing the cascading of objects.
The IBusinessObjectReferenceDataSource is usually implemented as a cross between the from which this interface is inherited and an or .
provides an implementation of this interface. Since the is determined by the selected , the generic will be sufficient for most (or possibly all) specialized business object models.

Property and Property Value Return Value
The parameter implements the interface. is evaluated for the value and the resulting string is returned.

The parameter implements the interface. The value's is returned.

The parameter implements the interface. The value's is returned.
The parameter implements the interface. The value is cast to a string and returned.
The value is . An empty string is returned.
The value is a list.
The string is parsed to check whether it begins with lines=<n>, where n is the number of items to render or all to render all items in the list. The value is then cast to and each item is processed according to the 's formatting logic. The resulting strings are concatenated and the total number of lines is appended, if not all items are shown.
